protocol_name: Manual dissection of the Schistosoma mansoni head and back end for transcriptomic analysis
protocol_name_html: Manual dissection of the Schistosoma mansoni head and back end for transcriptomic analysis
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dcgtm","text":"How to run Megahit version 1.1.3 (Li et al. 2015) through the iMicrobe plaform.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":34,"length":14,"key":0},{"offset":62,"length":8,"key":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cr7u6","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66hqg","text":"Megahit is a de-novo assembler for large and complex metagenomics NGS reads relying on succinct de Bruijn graph (SdBG) to achieve low memory assembly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":96,"length":9,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2oinn","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3u5d","text":"More informations about Megahit can be found here : https://github.com/voutcn/megahit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":52,"length":33,"key":2}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B18BF750CE6C11E8BD99478E9313FEFD","url":"https://academic.oup.com/bioinformatics/article/31/10/1674/177884"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https://www.imicrobe.us/"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https://github.com/voutcn/megahit"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"en6p3","text":"More informations and details about Megahit can be found there : https://github.com/voutcn/megahit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":65,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":65,"length":33,"key":0}],"data":{}},{"key":"a5nue","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8bcn0","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8b20n","text":"Several parameters are available to the user through the iMicrobe app. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":70,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6viqu","text":"Choosing k","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3i2vf","text":"MEGAHIT uses multiple k-mer strategy. Minimum k  (--k-min) , maximum k (--k-max) and the step for iteration (--k-step) can be set by options. Please not that k must be odd numbers while the step must be an even number.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":22,"length":1,"style":"italic"},{"offset":46,"length":3,"style":"italic"},{"offset":50,"length":7,"style":"italic"},{"offset":69,"length":1,"style":"italic"},{"offset":72,"length":7,"style":"italic"},{"offset":109,"length":8,"style":"italic"},{"offset":158,"length":1,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"71m4d","text":"Filtering (Kmin+1)-mer","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27m8d","text":"The parameter --min-count allows the user to discard (kmin+1)-mer with multiplicity lower than d . By default that parameter is set to 2. For high sequencing depth coverage (>40x), this value should be set to 3.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":14,"length":11,"style":"italic"},{"offset":54,"length":4,"style":"italic"},{"offset":95,"length":1,"style":"italic"},{"offset":55,"length":3,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90gk9","text":"mercy k-mer","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87o2h","text":"This tool is specially designed for metagenomics assembly to recover low  coverage sequence. For generic dataset >= 30x,  MEGAHIT may generate  better results with using the --no-mercy option.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":174,"length":10,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":174,"length":10,"key":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c9p8f","text":"K-min-1 pass mode ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bmvu","text":"This mode is more memory efficient for ultra low-depth datasets. It can be activated by using the option --kmin-1pass","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":105,"length":12,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":105,"length":12,"key":2}],"data":{}},{"key":"cq3pu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https://github.com/voutcn/megahit"}},"1":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":"--no-mercy"},"2":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":"--kmin-1pass"}}}
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"bboko","text":"Note :This protocol uses a samples from the HMP project (SRS143565). This sample is a right cubital fossa WGS dataset from a healthy female subject.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":148,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":57,"length":9,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"785p4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5o8ep","text":"Note : Currently this app cannot use a cart imput. Use a Cyverse datastore or URL imput.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":88,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3ihdq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2oj1d","text":"In the 'tools' dropdown menu, select 'Apps'. You are presented the list of apps currently available on iMicrobe. Click on imicrobe-megahit-0.0.2u1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":122,"length":24,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ep0dn","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dsnhj","text":"In the page app, open the datastore and provide the forward read and reverse read file in the corresponding imput fields.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":52,"length":13,"style":"bold"},{"offset":69,"length":12,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"co3lj","text":"Additionally, the user can tune the assembly parameter by passing a string of arguments in the \"Additional Command Line Arguments\" field. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":96,"length":33,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4c6cb","text":"Choosing k","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":10,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4qkal","text":"MEGAHIT uses multiple k-mer strategy. Minimum k  (--k-min) , maximum k (--k-max) and the step for iteration (--k-step) can be set by options. Please not that k must be odd numbers while the step must be an even number.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":22,"length":1,"style":"italic"},{"offset":46,"length":3,"style":"italic"},{"offset":50,"length":7,"style":"italic"},{"offset":69,"length":1,"style":"italic"},{"offset":72,"length":7,"style":"italic"},{"offset":109,"length":8,"style":"italic"},{"offset":158,"length":1,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9cdr2","text":"Filtering (Kmin+1)-mer","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":22,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1fn7v","text":"The parameter --min-count allows the user to discard (kmin+1)-mer with multiplicity lower than d . By default that parameter is set to 2. For high sequencing depth coverage (>40x), this value should be set to 3.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":14,"length":11,"style":"italic"},{"offset":54,"length":4,"style":"italic"},{"offset":95,"length":1,"style":"italic"},{"offset":55,"length":3,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dk7lp","text":"mercy k-mer","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":11,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9v9tn","text":"This tool is specially designed for metagenomics assembly to recover low  coverage sequence. For generic dataset >= 30x,  MEGAHIT may generate  better results with using the --no-mercy option.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":174,"length":10,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":174,"length":10,"key":2}],"data":[]},{"key":"86ipr","text":"K-min-1 pass mode ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":18,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1e9n1","text":"This mode is more memory efficient for ultra low-depth datasets. It can be activated by using the option --kmin-1pass","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":105,"length":12,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":105,"length":12,"key":3}],"data":[]},{"key":"40t8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"70g18","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9mdhj","text":"After the job is effectively ran, you can access your results using the drop-down menu 'Tools' and selecting 'Jobs'. Select the job corresponding to your centrifuge run, and go to the section 'Outputs'. The centrifuge output files are now in your cyverse datastore. Click on 'Browse and view output files in the CyVerse Datastore'.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5ar2g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8k0oa","text":"In the job folder created in the CyVerse datastore, the input fasta\/fastq files are copied, along with the logs of the job (*.err and *.out). In order to retrieve your results go to the megahit-out folder. It contains the following outputs:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":186,"length":11,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6famo","text":"final.contigs.fa : This fasta file contains the assembled contigs.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":16,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"sqn9","text":"log and opts.txt : Those text files contains the running log of the tool and the parameters chosen by the user respectively.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":3,"style":"bold"},{"offset":8,"length":9,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8fq59","text":"the folder intermediate_contigs:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":11,"length":20,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ar9v3","text":"kK.contigs.fa contains the contigs assembled from the de Bruijn graph of order-K, they can be converted to a SPAdes-like FASTG file for vizualisation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":13,"style":"bold"},{"offset":79,"length":1,"style":"bold"},{"offset":1,"length":1,"style":"italic"},{"offset":79,"length":1,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f3kmj","text":"kK.addi.fa contains the contigs assembled after iteratively removing local low coverage unitigs in the de Bruijn graph of order-K ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":10,"style":"bold"},{"offset":128,"length":1,"style":"bold"},{"offset":1,"length":1,"style":"italic"},{"offset":88,"length":7,"style":"italic"},{"offset":128,"length":1,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7a9un","text":"kK.local.fa contains the locally assembled contigs for k=K contains the stand-alone contigs for
